description:
Environment:
1. Two compute nodes A and B, each of them has four pci devices of "vendor_id":"8086","product_id":"150e", which have all been configured to passthrough_whitelist.
2. Controller nova conf configured to "pci_alias={"vendor_id":"8086", "product_id":"150e", "name":"a1"}"
3. Extra_specs of flavor pci_flavor configured to "{u'pci_passthrough:alias': u'a1:2'}".

Test Steps:
1. Create instance vm1 with pci_flavor, then vm1 is created on A, two of the pci devices were allocated.
2. Migrate vm1 from A to B, then vm1 state changed to error and two pci devices' status on node B changed to "claimed" while two pci devices on A are still "allocated".
title: migrating a vm with pci devices  caused DB inconsistent and vm state error
